TopicTitle: How many kerbals have you lost so far

Articles.Content:
.21 came just as i decided to start building and testing my own spaceplanes (and after career arrived i wornt restart a crashed test). So far i have 12 kerbals on the wall of memory. At 9 the kerbals called for a ejection system in the plane and this was installed. But Barney forgot to use it as his crew crashed.

How does your losses look so far?
Only Jeb as passed away for me oddly enough.
Zero, largely because there have only been two manned flights. Made sure Jeb was first Kerbal in space though.
Zero for me. Only have manned flights in proven designs. Any testing is done with unmanned vehicles.
Jebidiah...

in .21 ? haven't even had it for 24 hours yet so Zero

then again in my season 3 LP I only had 12 K.I.A. from .18 through .20.2

0

Thanks to the Rescue Tower that I add per default to all of my rockets

In my proper save I probably would have somewhere around ten. I don't know the exact amount because for some strange reason killing jeb bob and bill revived everyone who had been killed previously. In my foolaround save I guess around around hundred. decided to see how many kerbals i could kill but after a while i the game decided it didn't wan't me to do anything, and locked every button
None,I have serious program.

Bill and Ronald...

i save edit to bring Bill back tho'

Currently 0.

I killed Jeb, but revived him by going back in time, then ending the flight

None as of yet. I haven't done much yet, but now with permanent death, I will only man proven designs that have been mathematically calculated to achieve their purpose and have at least two escape systems.

I worry that I am taking this game a bit too seriously.

None so far, had to use an escape system once though, because the ship tore apart in the middle of the launch pad.

Edited July 25, 2013 by ForumHelper
I lost Frank in a plane accident. Okay though, I just reverted back to the runway.

Only lost one to see how the system works, he had no courage anyways.

-Lego
None yet. I thank the new ASAS for that, since I've primarily been messing around with planes. I may end up with kerbals trapped in a Munar orbit though.
No Kerbals lost so far. There was "an attempted assassination" of Jeb, Bill, and Bob, but their crash-protection (both kinds) saved them.

Technically none, I guess. I crashed a couple planes, but always just used the revert to SPH option

I actually did do a rescue mission though, which I rarely ever did before. I had a 3-man Mun lander with no parachute or docking ports. I got it back into Kerbin orbit, then launched an empty rescue ship for them to EVA to. Jeb was the last one out, and before he went EVA he turned on the engines of the lander to de-orbit it. He had a bit of a rough ride getting out of there, but he made it

None yet. I managed to get Jeb to the new Mun before realising that I didn't have the fuel to bring him back. After a few adjustments to the rocket and an unmanned control unit was added I sent him a rescue ship. All has gone to plan so far. I don't think I'll be sending poor Jeb out on anymore maiden voyages though

Well a kerbal i hired died in a plane crash, and then after a few more launches for some reason he came back from the dead...or they found his mangled body and reconstructed it So that means i have killed none so far haha

None, at the moment.

A couple dozen of Bills, Jebs, and Bobs before.
None? Wow I am amazed I still play same file since I started ksp (0.18)
0, we take safety very seriously at VASE.

NONE! on my second mission right now, first was duna and back, now its laythe and i really hope i have enough fuel.

Edit:

STATUS REPORT: yeah nah, they died.

Edited July 25, 2013 by GalaxyGryphon

None, except Bill, and that was because the game forgot to load any parts. Including the stock parts.

He was inside the capsule at the time.

But, I decided this was a glitch, and therefore it was appropriate to revive him with save editing.
